sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We'll take a look at the new tech trends for 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: With airports in Kazakhstan now closed, people wanting to flee the violent protests sweeping the country have been heading to the land border with Kyrgyzstan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The demonstrations began on Tuesday over a spike in fuel prices and have led to the deaths of dozens of protesters and 12 police officers as citizens stormed and set fire to government buildings. 12 police officers as citizens stormed and set fire to government buildings days of violent unrest have made authoritarian president tokaya fear for the nation's future for some opposition figures the protests signaled the beginning of the end of the government i think that this is the end of the regime the question is only how long it will take however thousands of russian troops have already arrived in Kazakhstan officially on a peacekeeping mission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: VLADIMIR PUTIN, Russian President- He called Putin for help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Putin wants to rebuild the former Soviet Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He took advantage of the situation, and, for us, it is an occupation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: JANE FERGUSON, Russian President- The U.N., U.S., the situation and for us it is an occupation. The UN, US, UK and France are calling on all parties to refrain from violence, but the regime is blaming what it called foreign-backed terrorist groups for the unrest, but hasn't provided any evidence for the claim. President Tokayev was re-elected in 2019 amid accusations from international observers of voter fraud.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: accusations from international observers of voter fraud. Russia is calling the uprising in Kazakhstan a foreign-inspired attempt to undermine the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: country's security and integrity by force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Top politicians in Moscow say that it is a threat not only to Russia's ally Kazakhstan but also to surrounding countries, including Russia itself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: When Kazakh President Kasym Zhamart-Takaev accused foreign-trained terrorist groups of driving the unrest and asked the Russian-led Collective Security Treaty Organization for help, Moscow did not hesitate. It rushed its paratroopers across the border overnight on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Belarus, Armenia, Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan will also provide their forces, however, their exact numbers have not been disclosed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some independent analysts say that the events in Kazakhstan are an extremely worrying signal for Moscow and that the Kremlin's strategy to safeguard its influence in the former Soviet Union has not changed. Russia says that it would consult with Kazakhstan on further steps to support the authorities. Neither Russia nor Kazakhstan has provided any evidence that protests were inspired from abroad. Galina Polonskaya for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Hill assault one year ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Bracing the winter cold, representatives held candles and observed a minute of silence.

sentences.sentence: Like many of you trapped in the house gallery, I remember every moment vividly.

sentences.sentence: I replay how I made plans to use my gas mask and my cane newly at my side from a five-week old knee replacement surgery to fight back if attacked.

sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization has issued a warning that the Omicron variant shouldn't be treated as a less dangerous variant of COVID disease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Despite producing milder symptoms, WHO officials say the speed at which it is spreading can still kill thousands of people worldwide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: While Omicron does appear to be less severe compared to Delta, especially in those vaccinated, it does not mean it should be categorized as mild.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Omicron is hospitalizing people and it's killing people.

sentences.sentence: In fact, the tsunami of cases is so huge and quick that it is overwhelming health systems around the world.

sentences.sentence: JOSE ALVARADO, Portugal will extend some pandemic measures, including telework, until January 14, Prime Minister Costa announced. To enter the country by playing a COVID-19 test will still be required, as for schools, they will reopen on Monday as planned, while an intensive campaign on vaccinations for children between the age of 5 and 11 will continue until January 9th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Despite having one of the lowest rates of infections per million in Europe, experts say nowhere will see a rise in new cases in the coming weeks due to Omicron.

sentences.sentence: Austria says it will fight this new wave with new restrictions, mainly tightening the lockdown for the unvaccinated and will do more to ensure the rules are enforced.

Most importantly, starting from the 15th of February, unvaccinated workers aged 50 or over must show a valid super green pass, which is Italy's health certificate, showing the holder has been either fully vaccinated against COVID or has recovered from the disease. Should they fail to show such pass, well, there is being fined between 600 and 1500 euros and after five days they will lose their salary although they won't be fired from their position.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Unvaccinated people aged 50 or older who are unemployed or retired will have to pay a fine of 100 euros if they don't get vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
